name: surgery
description: The collection of data elements related to a donor's surgical treatment at a specific point in the clinical record. To submit multiple surgeries, submit multiple rows in the Surgery file. If a specimen was resected during surgery, indicate the unique identifier of the specimen in the 'submitter_specimen_id' field. If multiple specimens were resected during a single surgical procedure, submit each 'submitter_specimen_id' as a new row with the same 'submitter_treatment_id' and 'surgery_type' values.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

fields.name: submitter_donor_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: If a specimen was resected during surgery, indicate the unique identifier of the specimen here. This submitter_specimen_id should exist in the Specimen file.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: surgery_type
fields.description: Indicate the type of surgical procedure that was performed. (References: SNOMED, NCIt, UMLS)

fields.name: surgery_site
fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where the surgical procedure was performed, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

meta.notes: Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344. This field is not required if a specimen was resected during surgery (ie. if `submitter_specimen_id` is submitted) since anatomic site is collected in the Specimen table.

fields.name: surgery_location
fields.description: Indicate whether the surgical procedure was done at the primary, local recurrence or metastatic location.

meta.notes: This field is not required if a specimen was resected during surgery (ie. if `submitter_specimen_id` is submitted) since type of specimen is collected in the Specimen table.

fields.name: tumour_length
fields.description: Indicate the length of the tumour, in millimetres (mm).

fields.name: tumour_width
fields.description: Indicate the width of the tumour, in millimetres (mm).

fields.name: greatest_dimension_tumour
fields.description: Indicate the greatest dimension or diameter of the tumour, in millimetres (mm). (Reference: NCIt C157135)

fields.name: tumour_focality
fields.description: Indicate the characterization of the location of the tumour. (Reference: NCIt: C157425)

fields.name: residual_tumour_classification
fields.description: Indicate the absence or presence of residual tumour after treatment. In some cases treated with surgery and/or with neoadjuvant therapy there will be residual tumour at the primary site after treatment because of incomplete resection or local and regional disease that extends beyond the limit of ability of resection. (Reference: AJCC 8th ed.)

meta.notes: RX (Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed), R0 (no residual tumour), R1 (microscopic residual tumour), R2 (macroscopic residual tumour)
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: margin_types_not_involved
fields.description: Indicate the margin type(s) not involved.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: margin_types_not_assessed
fields.description: Indicate the margin type(s) that cannot be assessed.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

fields.name: lymphovascular_invasion
fields.description: Indicate the absence or presence of lymphovascular invasion (LVI). LVI includes lymphatic invasion, vascular invasion and lymphovascular invasion. (Reference: AJCC 8th ed.)

codeList: Both lymphatic and small vessel and venous (large vessel) invasion
Lymphatic and small vessel invasion only

fields.name: perineural_invasion
fields.description: A morphologic finding referring to a tumour that has spread along and infiltrated nerve fibers. Indicate the presence or absence of perineural invasion. (Reference: NCIt: C48260, ICCR)

fields.name: extrathyroidal_extension
fields.description: Indicate the involvement of perithyroidal soft tissues by direct extension from the thyroid primary. (Reference: AJCC 8th Ed.)
